results.description: I dip, you dip, we dip this loaded sandwich into savory jus. Chuck roast is seared, then cooked in the Instant Pot with beef broth, soy sauce, rosemary, and aromatics until fall-apart-tender, then served on buttered French rolls with the reduced broth alongside for dipping.
results.name: Instant Pot French Dip Sandwich

compilations.description: There is nothing more classic, quintessential yet, or versatile than a sandwich. So we decided to give you 69 of them. The Chicken Bacon Ranch Sandwich Roll is perfect for a summer picnic. The Cuban from Miami never disappoints. For something out-of-the-box, we recommend our loaded Thanksgiving Dip Sandwich (we promise it tastes good all year around). And if you're on the vegan train, go for our tempeh bacon sandwich. Go get that bread already!
compilations.name: 69 Sandwiches From Tasty

results.seo_title: Instant Pot French Dip Sandwich Recipe by Tasty

instructions.display_text: On a cutting board, pat the chuck roast dry with paper towels. Season on all sides with salt and pepper.
Set the Instant Pot to sauté and add the olive oil. Once the oil begins to shimmer, add the chuck roast and brown on all sides, about 5 minutes per side. Remove the chuck roast and set aside.
Add the onion to the Instant Pot and cook, stirring often, until softened and golden brown, about 3 minutes. Add the garlic and cook, stirring constantly, until aromatic, about 1 minute.

Add the beef broth and scrape up any brown bits on the bottom of the pot. Add the soy sauce and rosemary and place the chuck roast on top.  Place the lid on the Instant Pot and set to pressure cook on high for 1 hour. Let the pressure naturally release.
Transfer the chuck roast to a large bowl and shred with 2 forks.
Meanwhile, set the Instant Pot to sauteé. Remove the rosemary sprigs and cook until the sauce is reduced by half, about 15 minutes. Transfer the sauce to a bowl.
Slice the French rolls open and spread ½ tablespoon of butter over each side. Add ½ cup of beef to each sandwich.
Serve the sandwiches with the jus on the side for dipping.

components.raw_text: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
4 tablespoons (½ stick) unsalted butter, room temperature

compilations.name: Fancy Sushi Roll Recipes
compilations.description: If you want to make restaurant style sushi at home, look no further! We’ve curated the best of the best sushi recipes by our favorite trained sushi professionals. Start with Nobu Style Cup Sushi and gorge your way through the Seared Salmon And Ikura Sushi Donut. Let's 'maki' these rolls right away!

compilations.name: 25 Rice Recipes
compilations.description: You can never go wrong with rice, and these easy, mouthwatering recipes prove that rice is an anytime food. Start your day with a sweet Fried Chicken Rice Burger or enjoy Pineapple Fried Rice on a special lunch date. But why settle for one when you have 25 options to try from? Let’s get cookin’!

Rice is filling. Rice is versatile. Rice is easy to cook. And these rice recipes will have you set for a whole month. Our one-pot Enchilada Rice is cheesy and easy to whip up. For something more fun and cute, try out our beef and broccoli Rice Triangles! If you want to challenge yourself, go all out with the show-stopping Lamb Biryani. Let's face it: with rice, you can never go wrong!
compilations.name: Rice In Everything!

compilations.description: We know you love rice as much as we do, but we also know the plain Jane rice recipes just don't cut it! We have curated the most unique and delectable rice recipes, you will definitely love! If you're in the mood for a yummy and fulfilling burger, try the Japanese Style Fried Chicken Rice Burger, pair that up with a the scintillating Mango Sticky Rice for a sweet surprise! The hardest part, you will not get enough of these rice recipes!
compilations.name: Rice Recipes You Will Love

compilations.description: There are not many ingredients more versatile than rice. Serve some beef and broccoli-stuffed rice triangles as an appetizer or think outside the box with our loaded, one-of-a-kind sushi rice dip. Finally, comfort yourself on a weeknight with our quick and homely one-pot enchilada rice. When you have rice on hand, the possibilities are endless.
compilations.name: Have A 'Rice' Day With These Mouth-watering Recipes

instructions.display_text: Wash and rinse the rice thoroughly to remove excess starch. Cook in a medium pot at high until the water reaches a boil. turn to low heat, and let it simmer for about 20 minutes.
While there is still some water in the pot, add the vinegar and sugar. Stir and remove from heat.
In a separate pan, add the oil and mushrooms. Cook until they begin to brown.
Add the soy sauces, green onions, and brown sugar. simmer for 2-3 minutes, adding small amounts of water if necessary.
Spray a square or round bowl with cooking oil, and press the rice into the edges with the back of a spoon.
Layer avocado slices around the edges and bottom of the rice.
Spoon in the mushroom sauce. Cover and pat down another layer of rice to seal in the goodness!
Place a serving plate on top of the bowl and flip upside-down. Remove the bowl carefully.
Sprinkle with black sesame seeds. Use a seaweed snack to grab.
